title: Communications Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Resources Institute (New Delhi)
Interview Descriptions: It was friendly and the interviewers largely wanted to get to know you. Questions were about experience and the the scope of the role was briefly explained. They didn't have any technical questions.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with the responsibilities of the role?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Resources Institute
Interview Descriptions: Very fast and responsive. I had 3 rounds of interviews. One with the reporting manager, one with the team and then the HR round. The interview process was a conversation more than an interview to try and understand past experience and interest in the sector
Interview Questions: Questions related to past experience and interest in the sector

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Resources Institute
Interview Descriptions: Friendly, on time, good experience. CV asked expectations asked, synergies explored, discussed other ambitious projects, Salary discussed., benchmarks & renumeration. company culture, climate change in India and in the global south

title: Legal Counsel Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at World Resources Institute (Mumbai) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: good. It was taken by HR and CEO. The questions asked were mainly about the past experience and FCRA compliances. Final interview as taken by Legal Counsel, US. The interview process was about 30 days long.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Resources Institute
Interview Descriptions: There were two stages of interviews. Both of them were semi-technical. The interviews went good but the interviewers didn't give any feedback or result. It's been more than two months now and I don't think they will contact me again.
Interview Questions: If I get a PhD offer while I am working for them, will I accept the offer?

title: Epp Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Resources Institute
Interview Descriptions:
By Microsoft team about 20 minutes they have taken the interview by 2 persons. They were very calm, positive and supportive throughout the interview.
Then they asked me some questions about my previous jobs. The questions they have asked was very logical.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself was the first question.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Resources Institute (Mumbai) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: seven rounds of interview and written test. Technology was used so that travel can be avoided, they also take panel interviews to save rounds. The turn around time is slow and it becomes difficult to track the progress.

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at World Resources Institute (Mumbai) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions:
It was a good experience. The process was timely. I was made to feel comfortable.
they took some time to get back to me after the interview with their final offer but it was worth the wait. There were 2 rounds of interview and both were crisp and precise. The questions were strictly work related o gauge my understanding of the field, my previous experience, and to check my fitment to the organization culture and environment.
Interview Questions: My understanding of the current trends in the field

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Resources Institute
Interview Descriptions: Telephonic interview. I got an internship through a competition. I was easier and there were less questions, but the the organization did not seem to be interested in taking interns.
Interview Questions: About the area of internship and what ideas do I have of my own?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Resources Institute
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was pretty straight forward. They make you comfortable to speak during the interview process. Also they are very open minded people. 
The process consists of :
1) Exam
2) Personal Interview
Interview Questions: What did you do during your work at Doordarshan?
